result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley N Weinke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradley N Weinke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradley N Weinke was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobriety, probation may be transfered to Dane County
AODA and comply with any recommedations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Bradley N Weinke in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2 and Ct. 5, in 15 CF 237 and Ct 1 in 15 CF 247, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in 15 CF 237 and Ct 2 in 15 CF 247 dismissed, 15 CF 237, Ct. 2 and Ct. 5 and 15 CF 247, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, 15 CF 237, Ct. 2, AODA and comply, DNA Sample, domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobriety, $543.00 costs, Ct. 5, AODA and comply, DNA Sample, domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobriety, $343.00 costs, 4 days sentence credit, 15 CF 247, AODA and comply, DNA Sample, domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobriety, $518.00 costs, firearms restriction, bond to be applied, probation may be transfered to Dane County,

Defendant, Bradley N Weinke, appeared. Jane Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF237 & 15CF247.  Victim gave statement.  State objects to modification of bond.  Defendant is trying to hire counsel.  Court denied motion.  Bond remains unchanged.

Defendant, Bradley N Weinke, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 15CF247 & 15CF237.  Defendant is trying to hire a lawyer.  Rights of preliminary hearing discussed. Defendant waived time limits in 15CF237.  Court accepted the waiver.   New dates set by court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 09:20 am.  Return date scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
victim request to amend bond conditions.

Defendant, Bradley N Weinke, appeared  by video with Attorney Riek. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived. $500 cash bond with no contact J.T., her residence, workplace, with except of telephone contact only for child placement, may return residence one time w/officer to get belongings and felony conds. Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
